title: BBC Local Live: Leicestershire on Wednesday 1 March 2017 - BBC News
summary: leicester city hold informal talks with hodgson .
news , sport , travel and weather updates resume at 08:00 thursday .

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: that 's all from leicestershire local live - updates will start again on thursday at 08:00

documents.title: weather : some heavy rain this evening
text: outbreaks of rain will spread in from south through the evening and will be heavy at points .
a minimum temperature of 2c ( 36f ) .
a cloudy and breezy start to thursday with outbreaks of rain through the morning .
brightening up into the afternoon with some sunshine for a time and the winds will ease .
author: Lucy Martin
BBC Weather

documents.title: your questions : is there link between village names starting with 'th ' ?
text: using your questions david finnigan asked : leicestershire has a lot of villages beginning with the letters `` th '' is there a link ?
i 've compiled a list of towns/villages in the county starting with these letters : thurmaston , thrussington , thurnby , thornton , thringstone , theddingworth , thurcaston and thurlaston .
there are also a few with `` thorpe '' but i 'll get onto them .
dr richard jones from the university of leicester has said most of these contain scandinavian personal names , such as thormothir ( thurmaston ) and thorsteinn ( thrussington ) .
most of the place names also have `` tun '' at the end - dr jones said that was old english for `` estate , farm , village '' .
he does n't however believe there is any kind of link between the towns .
however , professor john martin from de montfort university said he was pretty sure the `` th '' at the start of place names was a variation of the term `` thorp '' meaning small hamlet or village .
we have a few of those in leicestershire as well - thorpe satchville , thorpe astley , thorpe arnold thorpe langton .
he said it 's also quite common at the end of village names - like countesthorpe .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: watch : tools stolen from van in birstall
text: a builder from birstall has captured thieves on camera stealing £ 1,000 worth of tools from his van
the owner is now warning other van owners about thieves getting access to vans using some sort of `` device '' .
this is because the offenders managed to get inside the van without `` breaking in '' .
police have confirmed they are investigating but so far no arrests have been made .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: church preparing roof for funeral service
text: yesterday i told you about copper being stolen from the roof of st peter 's church in kirby bellars .
radio leicester has been over to see them this afternoon as workmen try to patch the holes with tarpaulin - the church needs to be ready to host a funeral tomorrow .
english heritage rules mean the church should have to replace the stolen copper but discussions are under way to allow them to use a less valuable material to avoid being a target to thieves again .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: your photos : sunshine and blue skies
text: our bbc weather watcher maggie t has sent in this lovely photo of blue sky above loughborough this afternoon
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: police appeal to find football fans after disorder in millwall
text: the metropolitan police are looking for these men , thought to be leicester city fans .
it 's after violence and disorder broke out after the fa cup match against millwall on saturday 18 february .
police have said both sets of fans threw missiles including seats and bottles .
detective chief inspector john oldham said : this was des behaviour and has absolutely no place at a football match .
it was pure luck that no-one was badly hurt . ''
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: fire in ashby closes road
text: the incident being dealt with was a fire on the first floor of a commercial building .
one person was rescued by the fire service and treated by paramedics .
the fire is now out .
market street in the centre of ashby de la zouche is closed between bath street and north street as emergency services deal with an incident
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: your comments : elephants to leave zoo
text: james hartshorn has been in touch on twitter about twycross zoo 's plans to find a new home for their four asian elephants .
he said : `` sad to see them go , here 's a photo of them from last year . ''
elephants to leave twycross zoo
sad to see them go , here 's a photo of them from last year
author: Twitter

documents.title: family negotiating with us authorities over cancer treatment
text: a brave nine-year-old lutterworth lad with a rare form of cancer could be kicked out of america before finishing the only treatment that could save his life .
author: Rugby & Lutterworth Observer

documents.title: afternoon weather update
text: generally dry and bright with a fair amount of cloud also in the mix .
highs of 9c ( 48f ) .
author: Charlie Slater
BBC Weather presenter

documents.title: fire at chicken shop in leicester
text: i 've just been speaking to the fire service about the fire on granby street in leicester .
it was at maryland chicken in their ground floor kitchen area .
the fire has now been put out but there is smoke on the upper floors - they are still at the scene .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: travel : fire blocks granby street
text: in # leicester granby street is blocked due to a fire , all traffic using dover st for now .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: leicester hold talks with hodgson
text: premier league champions leicester have held informal talks with former england boss roy hodgson about becoming their new manager .
however , it is thought that the 69-year-old was just one potential candidate spoken to in the search for claudio ranieri 's replacement .
and acting boss craig shakespeare could stay in charge until the end of the season if results continue to improve .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: your questions : how many farms were flooded to create rutland water ?
text: rose arnold , who used to visit a relative in oakham , got in touch using your questions to ask how many farms were flooded to create rutland water .
apparently , 29 agricultural tenancies were lost when it was created in the mid-1970s .
in total , 3 % of the entire county was flooded to create the reservoir .
author: Calum McKenzie
BBC Local Live

documents.title: elephants to leave twycross zoo
text: twycross zoo will be finding a new home for its four female asian elephants
the zoo has released a statement saying they hope this will allow the animals to breed , ensuring their long-term survival .
esha was the last baby elephant to be born at the zoo in 2014 - she was conceived artificially .
to have a male elephant on the site the zoo would need a separate enclosure .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: simpson keen on shakespeare to be foxes new manager
text: danny simpson is backing craig shakespeare to become the leicester city 's permanent manager .
he said : `` i ca n't see why not , but it 's the chairman 's decision .
it 's up to him and he owns the club , he is passionate about the club .
those decisions are nothing to do with us but , for me , he [ shakespeare ] has been really good .
`` since day one he has helped me a lot .
he is a top coach , a top guy and he has taken it on naturally .
he has kept it simple and told us what he wanted to do , which was simple and basic , and we 've done that so let 's hope we can carry it on for him .
`` the chairman is his own man and he makes his decisions .
all we have to do is play football .
we know we have n't played how we can - we 're first to admit that - but we have to carry on .
leicester carries on . ''
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: leicester mercury news
text: today 's front page - read the headline story here .
author: Leicester Mercury

documents.title: three companies set to bid for east midlands rail franchise
text: three companies have qualified for the chance to bid to run the east midlands rail franchise , the department for transport has announced .
arriva rail east midlands , first trenitalia east midlands rail and stagecoach east midlands trains are the three companies looking to run the services from november 2018 .
each company will soon be invited to bid and they will then be assessed for what passenger benefits they offer and whether they represent value for money .
author: Calum McKenzie
BBC Local Live

documents.title: watch : the sound of spring at watermead park
text: the birds are having a good sing-song to celebrate the start of spring in leicestershire
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: rugby : genge and williams released by england
text: leicester tigers will have both ellis genge and mike williams available for friday 's match against exeter after they were released by england .
dan cole and ben youngs have been retained .
author: BBC Leicester Sport

documents.title: latest leicestershire headlines
text: latest leicestershire headlines
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: leicestershire 's 'bionic woman ' receives mbe
text: a leicestershire campaigner and fundraiser has collected an mbe from buckingham palace
claire lomas from eye kettleby was paralysed in a horse riding accident in 2007 .
she attracted international attention for completing the london marathon in a bionic suit and raising over half a million pounds for spinal research .
she collected her award from prince william and joked after about one of the upsides to being paralysed : `` i did not have to curtsy .
it was one less thing to worry about . ''
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: east midlands weather forecast
text: east midlands weather forecast

BBC Weather

documents.title: your photos : daffodils in bloom
text: on twitter mark bee has sent in a photo of the early signs of spring at loughborough university
author: Twitter

documents.title: is hodgson interested in leicester job ?
text: former england manager roy hodgson has held secret talks about the leicester job .
author: The Daily Mail

documents.title: campaign for ranieri statue
text: two men from leicester have started an online campaign to build a statue in honour of claudio ranieri .
james dillon and josh phillips are looking to raise £ 10,000 - so far they have £ 770 .
james told bbc radio leicester they wanted to do something to recognise the former leicester city boss .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: shakespeare in talks with foxes owners
text: craig shakespeare will meet leicester 's owners on wednesday , with his players backing the caretaker boss for the job full time .
author: Daily Mirror

documents.title: crackdown on drivers using their phones
text: our local police force is reminding us this morning that the law has changed when it comes to using your mobile phone while driving - the penalty is now much tougher
if you think you can get out of paying the fine by going on a `` driver awareness course '' think again - that is no longer an option for this offence .
the penalties have got tougher .
it 's now 6 points and £ 200 if you hold and use your phone while driving .
put your phone away # itcanwait
@ twitterid so if phone on speaker or with earphones is that ok ?
hi louise , handsfree devices will remain legal .
thank you for getting back to me .
righto , phones down !
just let me finish this tweet and send
@ twitterid what is defined as `` while driving '' ?
clearly it 's dangerous and stupid to use a phone whilst a car is in motion .
how many people get caught ?
not enough i suspect
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: good morning : join us for today 's live news coverage
text: hello leicestershire - i 'll be writing your local live updates today with all the latest news , sport , weather and travel .
as we are now in march , lets start the day with a nice spring-like photo from kegworth
if you 'd like your spring photos to feature on this page you can send them in by email , facebook or twitter .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live
